verses.verse: At that time the disciples came to Jesus saying, "Who is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?"
Jesus called a little child to him and set him in their midst,
and said, "Truly I say to you: Unless you are converted and become like little children, you will not enter the Kingdom of Heaven.
"Whosoever therefore will humble himself like this little child, the same is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.
"And whosoever will receive one such little one in my name receives me.
"But whosoever will offend one of these ones who believe in me, it would be better that a huge millstone were hung around his neck, and he would drown in the depths of the sea.
"Woe to the world because of its snares, for it is inevitable that temptations come, but woe to that man by whom the temptation comes from.

"Therefore if your hand or your foot is what snares you cut them off and thrown [them] away from you; it is better for you to enter into life crippled or disfigured than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into everlasting fire.
"And if your eye is what snares you, pluck it out and throw [it] from you; it is better for you to enter into life with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell fire.
"Be careful that you don't despise one of these little ones, for I say to you: that in heaven their angels do always look at the face of my Father who is in heaven.
"For the Son of Man came to save that which was lost.
"What do you think? If a man has a hundred sheep and one of them wanders off, doesn't he leave the ninety nine and go into the mountains and searches for the one who wandered off?
"And if it happens that he finds it, truly I say to you that he rejoices more for that [sheep] than for the ninety nine who didn't wander off.
"Eve so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should die.
"Moreover if your brother sins against you, go and tell him privately. If he listens to you, you have gained your brother.
"But if he will not listen, then take with you one or two more, so that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word can be verified.
"But if he will refuse to listen to them, tell it to the congregation. If he refuses to listen to the congregation, let him be considered as a heathen and publican to you.
"Truly I say to you: Whatever you will decide to forbid on earth will be forbidden in heaven, and whatever you will permit on earth will be permitted in heaven.
"Again I say to you: that if two of you will agree on earth concerning anything that they ask, it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven.
"For where two or three are gathered together in my name, I am there in their midst."
Then Peter came to him and said, "Lord, how often will my brother sin against me and I forgive him--until seven times?"
Jesus said to him, "I say to you not until seven times but until seventy times seven.
"Therefore the Kingdom of Heaven is compared to a certain king who wanted to take an account from his servants.
"When he had started taking [it], one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.
"But since he had no way to repay, his lord commanded him to be sold even his wife, children, and everything that he had for repayment.
"Then the servant fell down and kneeled before him saying, «Lord have patience with me, and I will repay all to you.»
"Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion and loosened him and forgave him that debt.
"Now that same servant went out and found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denarii, and he laid his hand on him and took [him] by the throat saying, «Pay me what you owe.»
"His fellow servant fell down at his feet and pleaded with him saying, «Have patience with me, and I will repay you all.»
"But he would not, but went and threw him into prison until he would repay the debt.
"So when his fellow servants saw what happened, they were very sad and came and told their lord everything that had happened.
"Then his lord after calling him in said, «O you wicked servant, I forgave you all that debt, because you asked me to.
"Shouldn't you also have compassion on your fellow servant like I had pity on you?»
"His lord was very angry and turned him over to the tormenters, until he would repay everything that was due him.
"So in the same way will my heavenly Father also do to you, if you don't forgive from your hearts every one of his brother's sins."
